abstract: Death of Libyan dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddafi reverberates across Syria, reviving protests that had begun to stall and focusing attention on newly organized, unarmed opposition group known as the Syrian National Council; organization is seeking to challenge four decade reign of Pres Bashar al-Assad's family.
snippet: The Syrian National Council has closed ranks in the most concerted attempt yet to forge an alternative to President Bashar al-Assad.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: The Syrian National Council has closed ranks in the most concerted attempt yet to forge an alternative to President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Death of Qaddafi Revives Opposition, and Hope, in Syria
headline.print_headline: Death of Qaddafi Revives Opposition in Syria
headline.seo: Qaddafi’s Death Stirs New Protests, and Hope, in Syria
